properties.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 6 at 3:05AM MST until January 6 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland KS
properties.description:
* WHAT...Northwest winds sustained at 35 to 45 mph with gusts as
high as 55 to 65 mph.

* WHERE...Cheyenne, Sherman, Wallace and Greeley Counties.

* WHEN...From 10 AM MST /11 AM CST/ this morning to 5 PM MST /6
PM CST/ this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions are anticipated to be the
primary impact. High profile vehicles will be most at-risk,
particularly on well-traveled routes such as Interstate 70,
Highway 385, Highway 27, Highway 34, and Highway 36. Winds of
this magnitude may also down trees, power lines, and damage
property.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Northwest winds will noticeably strengthen
late this morning and early this afternoon. Strong winds will
persist through the afternoon. Winds will rapidly weaken
around, or shortly before, sunset this evening.
properties.instruction:
Secure loose outdoor items. Travelers in eastern Colorado and
northwest Kansas are urged to exercise additional caution this
afternoon.

High dust concentrations can aggravate asthma and cause
respiratory problems, especially in children, the elderly, or
those with pre-existing respiratory conditions. The Kansas
Department of Health and Environment recommends taking
preventative measures such as staying indoors or wearing
protective breathing masks, if outside.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM MST /11 AM CST/ THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON
